item.title: New publication in Nature Communications
item.description:
Margo Diricks developed a cgMLST scheme for M. abscessus facilitating the identification of dominant circulating clones (DCCs) and the according subspecies. The paper has been published in Nature Communications.

It's open access and can be read at ntmcope.org, the Journal's Homepage, or PubMed.

Congrats Margo for this great work!

item.title: New publication in Microbiology spectrum
item.description:
We are happy to have published the data from the MOMA-CF study in Microbiology spectrum and thank all collaborators for the succesful outcome of the study.

See the publication at ntmcope.org, the Journal Homepage, or PubMed.

item.title: ESM Paper of the Quarter award
item.description:
The ntmscope-publication "High overall mortality of Mycobacterium genavense infections and impact of antimycobacterial therapy: Systematic review and individual patient data meta-analysis" has been awarded ESM's "Paper of the Qarter Award" for Q4 2021.

We are very thankful for the positive feedback. The prize money will be invested in future and ongoing ntmscope-projects.

See the news at the European Society of Mycobacteriology's homepage

See the publication at ntmcope.org

item.title: ESM Meeting 2022
item.description:
Margo Diricks will give a talk on her work "Delineating Mycobacterium abscessus population structure employing high-resolution core genome mulitlocus sequence typing" at the annual meeting of the European Society of Myocbacteriology in Bologna on Tuesday, 28th June at 3 p.m.

The talk can be followed online, as well.

ESM conference homepage

item.title: ECCMID 2022
item.description:
The results of the MOMA_CF study will be presented at this year's ECCMID in Lissabon, on April 25 at 9h30, Hall K, in the session Cutting edge in mycobacterial research.

We'll be happy to see you there.

item.title: ntmscope.org is online
item.description:
Welcome to ntmscope.org


We are happy to finally have launched our website. ntmscope.org is the homepage of a research consortium that investigates infections caused by non-tuberculous mycobacteria. On this site we will share ongoing projects, latest news and other relevant information.

Don't hesitate to get in touch!
